I was running from my brother and his friends
And tasted the sweet perfume of the mountain grass I rolled down

Made friends and lost them through the years
And I've not seen the roaring fields in so long
I know I've grown
But I can't wait to go home

I'm on my way

Singing to "Tiny Dancer"
And I miss the way
You make me feel
And it's real
When we watched the sunset over the castle on the hill

Fifteen years old and smoking hand-rolled cigarettes
Running from the law through the backfields and getting drunk with my friends
Had my first kiss on a Friday night
I don't reckon that I did it right

I was younger then,
Take me back to when

We found weekend jobs, when we got paid
We'd buy cheap spirits and drink them straight
Me and my friends have not thrown up in so long
Oh, how we've grown
But I can't wait to go home

I'm on my way
Driving at 90 down those country lanes
Singing to "Tiny Dancer"
And I miss the way
You make me feel
And it's real
When we watched the sunset over the castle on the hill
Over the castle on the hill

I'm only 17 but I'm so glad this song can preserve my memories forever. In a few decades I'll be listening to this and remember drinking on the beach in the evening listening to my friends' laughter in the background, long heartfelt conversations over smoothies and fries, sitting on the sidewalk eating breakfast and rushing homework, shouting at each other over loud rock music in bedrooms. I love that I'm 17 and I wish things would never change.

Ed Sheeran/ Castle on the Hill

I actually grew up in this small area of Suffolk and Ed is just a year younger than me. We hung out in the same friendship circles, he was always very pleasant but I can’t say much about him because just a friend of a friend. But this song and this music video literally takes me back to high school and college. Growing up in sleepy Suffolk was dreamlike and Ed’s right, sometimes a little boring. We all craved some excitement. The castle shown and talked about is Framlingham Castle, spend many an evening there drinking huge bottles of cider and smoking roll ups. This song is a spot on the way he talks about it and makes me so nostalgic! I literally recognize every place in the video from when I was the same age as what Ed is describing now. What I was give to go back to that time! I’m really glad he filmed this video around Framlingham ! I can’t describe the feeling watching this. I now live in a different country, but this place is my home

I sit and gaze at the setting sun
The ocean bubbling away in the backdrop
A golden silence descending on the earth
Streaks of light blazing from the horizon

Gentle steps announce her coming
Dancing on the waves as they come and go
Lightening up the world as the sun fades
The stars come out to watch her sway

I look over and I see people gather
Her radiance too powerful to ignore
She dances and dances without a care
And like moths we watch and move closer
How often does perfection pass you by

She slows down and she looks over
And then, then our eyes meet
The ocean slows down, The universe sighs
And I feel myself slip
Losing myself in the depths of her eyes

                                   Udhay Boparai

Gw emang gak pintar bergaul gw terlalu pemilih buat orang yg gw panggil sahabat ,tapi gw selalu coba berusaha buat ada ketika teman2 gw butuh bantuan gw ,gak perlu gw ceritain.Gw gak pernah ketemu mereka lagi tapi gw tetap ingat mereka dan gw yg selalu cari kabar mereka duluan.Langsung kebayang wajah2 mereka teman2 pas sekolah dulu , waktu kerja di Batam sama anak2 bsfc , teman waktu kerja di Jakarta pertama kali mereka yg belain gw waktu ada masalah itu ,teman di poin square si barista , toko roti , teman security , teman waktu SPG an ,teman waktu nge dj ,sampai  yg udah pergi ninggalin gw buat selama lama nya .Mereka tuh baik2 banget ke gw ketika gw ada masalah dirumah keluarga pasti mereka berusaha ngebantu gw.Dan itu jauh sebelum gw kenal si monster sama circle nya setan2 itu, gw masih ngerasa hidup gw normal tanpa setingan.Hadiah ulang tahun dari teman sekelas gw dulu ga perlu gw sebut namanya , teman SMP yg pernah kasih gw tempat tinggal hampir seminggu lebih gara2 gw kabur dari rumah gak perlu gw kasih tau bahkan teman sekolah gw yg jadi sahabat gw sampai sekarang ketika semua bilang gw ini jahat, silahkan tanya kan ke dia apa gw sejahat itu.Bahkan si Barista itu yg selalu ada buat gw mulai gw senang sampai ada masalah bahkan dia paling marah waktu ada kejadian itu.Dia teman partama kali di Jakarta yg gw samperin minta tolong butuh tempat buat nginap kabur dari rumah.Masih ada Lagi teman2 yg baik sama gw yg gak perlu gw kasih tau ,yg dulu berjalan normal sebelum kenal si monster dan circle setan nya itu.Semua ga ada setingan normal .Teman di Batam satu kamar gw si kakak..... Yg sayang banget sama gw selalu belain gw kasih bantuan ke gw pas didormitory.Banyak lagi ketika gw susah mereka selalu ada karna sebaliknya ketika mereka butuh bantuan gw ,gw bakal berusaha bantu ada sebisa mungkin.Yg bilang gw gak punya teman mereka yg gak kenal gw ..Hidup gw dulu normal berjalan apa adanya , seperti yg lain . Sampai akhirnya gw kenal mereka sama circle nya setan itu ,gw jadi berubah , silahkan tanya kan ke mereka kenapa gw jadi narik diri ,Gak seperti dulu lagi.IYA EMANG GW YANG SALAH .GW WAKTU ITU SALAH MILIH CIRCLE PERTEMANAN YANG AKHIRNYA JADI musibah buat gw sama keluarga gw.Makanya makin kesini gw makin berpikir semua ini kesalahan gw biar aja gw yang nanggung sendiri .Tunggu sampai situasi normal gw sampai bisa nemuin hal yang menarik buat gw .Gw bakal masa bodo cuekin mereka yg mantau gw 24 jam yg nyuri privasi kebebasan gw.Bertahun tahun mereka lakuin itu ke gw, belum lagi mereka selalu ngejebak gw , ngerjain gw gimana cara nya supaya hidup gw hancur , tiap pekerjaan yg gw jalanin ketika gw mulai pahamin pasti diusik mereka gimana caranya supaya gw berhenti kerja sampai sekarang ini juga gitu mereka berusaha buat hancurin usaha kerjaan gw ,ngirim orang mata2 in gw buat ngancurin kerjaan usaha gw yg mereka mau itu bikin hidup gw menderita pelan pelan ,jahat iya emang dari dulu

I was running from my brother and his friends
tasted the sweet perfume of the mountain grass I rolled down
I was younger then, take me back to when I 
Found my heart and broke it here, made friends and lost them through the years
And I’ve not seen the roaring fields in so long, I know, I’ve grown 
but I can’t wait to go home 

I’m on my way, driving at 90 down those country lanes
Singing to Tiny Dancer, And I miss the way you make me feel, and it’s real
When we watched the sunset over the castle on the hill

Fifteen years old and smoking hand rolled cigarettes
Running from the law through the backfields and getting drunk with my friends 
Had my first kiss on a Friday night, I don’t reckon I did it right
I was younger then, take me back to when we found
Weekend jobs when we got paid and buy cheap spirits and drink them straight 
Me and my friends have not thrown up in so long, oh how we’ve grown
I can’t wait to go home

I’m on my way, driving at 90 down those country lanes
Singing to Tiny Dancer, And I miss the way you make me feel, it’s real
When we watched the sunset over the castle on the hill
Over the castle on the hill

One friend left to sell clothes
One works down by the coast 
One had two kids but lives alone
One’s brother overdosed
Ones already on his second wife
Ones just barely getting by
But these people raised me
And I can’t wait to go home

And I’m on my way, and I still remember those country lanes
When we did not know the answers, And I miss the way you make me feel, it’s real
When we watched the sunset over the castle on the hill
Over the castle on the hill
Over the castle on the hill 
 
About Ed Sheeran: 
Ed Sheeran may be the quintessential pop star of the 2010s: an internationally acclaimed, multi-award winning singer/songwriter who seems to acknowledge no boundaries between styles or eras with elements of folk, hip-hop, pop, dance, soul, and rock woven throughout his music. 

His incredible catalogue includes the studio albums ‘+’ (plus), ‘x’ (multiply) and ‘÷’ (divide) which spawned hit singles such as ‘The A team’ , ’Lego House’, ‘Sing', ‘Thinking Out Loud’, ‘Photograph’, ‘Shape Of You’, ‘Castle on The Hill’ and ‘Perfect’. 
 
In 2019, Ed Sheeran released the genre-spanning ‘No.6 Collaborations Project’ which featured a wide-range of artists including ‘Justin Bieber’, ‘Camilla’ Cabello’, ‘Travis Scott’, ‘Eminem’, ‘Cardi B, ‘Paulo Londra’, ‘Bruno Mars’ and ‘Stormzy’ amongst many others, producing hits such as ‘I Don’t Care’, ‘Beautiful People’, ‘South of The Border’ and ‘Take Me Back To London’.

*It's February 2022 Let's see how many legends and fans are still listening to this masterpiece........!*

This song NEVER gets old..no matter how many times I listen to it I see all my favourite memories flashing before my eyes. Late nights at an old playground, now destroyed, laughs with people I haven't talked to in years, birthday parties with old classmates..I didn't know I was making memories back then, I thought nothing would change. I guess it did. I don't even remember the last time I played carelessly with my friends until it got dark. I miss it and worse thing is, those years are not coming back. I let them pass and only now I understand I was making memories that will stay with me forever<3 I wish I had figured it out sooner..

The only Ed Sheeran song I keep coming back to because its about home and my home, in particular. I loved that Ed didn't shy away from making a song about Suffolk and I loved that the castle that I used to visit frequently in my youth is featured prominently. Every time I return to Suffolk to see relatives and old friends, this songs on at full blast. 

Still don't know wtf he's talking about when he mentions mountains because Suffolk's one of the lowest-lying areas of the UK. But I get that its meant to be about nostalgia for home in general. Just can't help but yell "REPRESENT" every time, though, because Suffolk is one of those gems of a county that gets so often overlooked in the UK.

I love all the shots in it as well and how they're often places I recognise. The Felixtowe docks, the banger races, those old pubs down by the waterfront and along the coast, abandoned farmhouses, those cold 5th November nights standing around a bonfire with the Guy Fawkes effigy. so many things I remember going to and climbing on in my youth. It probably weird to have this much nostalgia for the good old days when I'm only 20.

It’s 2022. Soon I’ll be 15, the day before  Ed’s birthday. I wish I discovered this song as soon as it came out. I’m from Puerto Rico, and one of the main things our capital is characterized by is a castle on a hill. Sometimes I feel like every song Ed Sheeran drops is meant for me, but they’re for everyone. No matter what, each one of his songs will touch our souls in such a way, relatable or not. Pls Ed, keep on going.

I remember this song :)

This perfectly captures being a teenager. Careless, rebellious, not knowing who we are. Even if we didn’t know it, we were making memories. I was still in high school when this released. I never got what it meant until now. Now, I’m missing all the times my friends and I had together. The times we skipped school, the random kisses, and playing games in the fields. We still know each other but not as well as before. We drifted apart over the years and I can’t help but miss those days. Even if you didn’t go through exactly what I did, we can all relate to this song. That’s the power of this song. Thanks Ed
